entry.title: Re: Fiori Elements Value Help token shows GUID instead of...
entry.content:
@ncrim7 

You need to add this annotation to your ProductManagerEntities:

annotate service.ProductManagerEntities with {
    @Common.Text: fullName
    @Common.TextArrangement: #TextOnly
    ID
};

The @Common.Text annotation on the ID field of the ValueList entity itself is what makes Fiori Elements display text instead of GUID in filter tokens.

entry.title: Manage My Timesheet (F1823) â€“ Why is it possible to record hours when CO period is closed
entry.content:
Hi everyone,


Iâ€™m working in SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud and Iâ€™ve encountered a behavior in the Manage My Timesheet app (ID F1823) that I cannot fully understand.
When I record hours in F1823 on a Controlling-related object, for example an activity that triggers a redistribution posting of type RKL, I see the following behavior:


1. CO period open
- The system correctly creates a CO document
- Costs are posted to the CO object


2. CO period closed
- The time entry is still accepted by the app
- No CO document is created (which makes sense because the period is closed)
- The CDS view behind F1823 still stores the recorded hours and activity without cost and without any CO document

I would expect the system to block the time entry in F1823 if the CO period is already closed, similar to what happens in on-premise environments or other processes that require immediate CO posting.

Does it make sense that users can enter hours in a period where CO posting is no longer possible, generating an incomplete record without any CO impact?


From my point of view, this behavior appears incorrect or at least inconsistent:
â€¢ The CDS ends up storing hours with no costs
â€¢ The user receives no error or warning
â€¢ The record is technically incomplete (missing the CO document)
Is this behavior standard and intentional in the Public Cloud? Or is it a misconfiguration, an unexpected system behavior, or even a known issue?


Specifically, I would like to understand:
1. Should F1823 allow time entries when the CO period is closed?
2. Is there any standard control to prevent this?
3. Has anyone else experienced this issue, especially with RKL postings?
4. Is there any SAP Note or clarification addressing this scenario?


Thanks in advance for your support and insights!

entry.title: SAP Datasphere vs Others (GCP, Azure, etc) - Business Case ??
entry.content:
Dear all,

I hope you have a very nice day! Sorry for the long question below. I am trying to set up the context and get some other inputs than what I see at the moment.

I am currently working with a client trying to make his way in the great world of Data. Basically, the situation is that the core processes of a Business Area will run with SAP (target is 1 instance and not 3 as today, ECC for now, but S/4 in the near future), and other specific applications. The implementation of SAP involved the implementation of a BW on HANA system (Yes, I know...not the latest stuff). But instead of feeding the BW through regular datasource extractions, they leveraged an SLT system to be near real time for most of their reports sourcing data from their current various SAP landscape. So, they have "rebuilt" lots of calculation views to support their business users. They also have many front ends (BOBJ, PowerBI, Spotfire, and other specialized applications). The maturity of BI is still, not low, but more oriented on checking consistency, very operational and less strategic than it could be. 

So we have : ECCs -> SLT -> HANA DB -> CalcViews -> Composite Providers (for managing authorizations)

They are at a stage of the implementation where the question has been raised to move to SAP Datasphere or to another data manager provider (something like Azure, GCP, Snowflake). The question is raised because they do not have only SAP data, and the overall group (other business areas are in the group) direction is to go to a non SAP landscape for data analytics.

The current exercise is to analyze the options, and choose the most long term viable one: staying with SAP analytics solutions, or moving away. In my current analysis, I am struggling because I don't find any "automatic" ways to convert/migrate the calculation views from BW on HANA directly to SAP Datasphere, provided by SAP. 

I have found the HANACV2SQL software, but I would have had expected SAP to support that kind of scenario. 

So, my question is : What could be the arguments to keep SAP Datasphere when:

  • what ever happens, you will need to convert using the same tool at the same costs ?
  • connectivity to front ends will be subject to reinstallation
  • row level security needs to be reimplemented 
  • SAP Datasphere restricts "data replication" to other systems if the data is used for other applications.

I have been working in the SAP ecosystem for a long time, and the Analytics strategy has always been hard to implement with SAP. The 0 copy concepts and the sharing capabilities promoted by SAP Datasphere (even the partnerships with Snowflake and GCP) are not clear form my point of view. Even if the client is SAP Centric, you need dedicated resources on the technology, which could lead to higher costs...

Any arguments that you have seen promoting one side more than another ?

 

Thanks for reading and sharing ðŸ˜‰

 

Cheers

entry.title: Re: Cannot find custom G/L acct under default transport r...
entry.content:
Hello @khanhlynx99 

Thank you for your question.

Have a look at the following link. It explains how the transports and the required business configuration flows. https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_S4HANA_CLOUD/b249d650b15e4b3d9fc2077ee921abd0/1a02302321054e6ab4d9e7244156d31b.html?locale=en-US

Based on your screenshots and details, you cannot create G/L accounts through the Manage G/L Account Master Data app in public cloud. Transport requests do not capture that either. The reason is G/L master data is part of Business Configuration content and not to technical customising which is transported through the Export Customising Transports App. Therefore, you will not see any popup when you create G/L account, system will not add any entries to DEFAULT_CUST/CUSY and your G/L account will not appear in any transport request.

To summarise, in public cloud G/L account master data is transferred to the test and production system when you activate content and not through customer transports. Ony configuration items that are maintained through SSCUIs for example Automatic Account Determination can generate transport entries. This is the reason why you only see that activity in your Export Customizing Transports App.

 

Let me know if you have further questions.

 

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: BRf+ - OPD Transition Help Condition Determination
entry.content:
Dear @GAK1,

Could you clarify your question, customer number?

My suggestion is based on additional fields, with this EDI vs FORM custom field approach you actually never maintain customer numbers directly in OPD.
All customer-specific logic goes into the new BP field; OPD only reads the value of that field.

For every customer:

  1. Open Manage Customer Master Data
  2. Go to the General data or where you enabled the field.
  3. Youâ€™ll see your new Output Channel (EDI/FORM) field.
  4. Set:
    • EDI for EDI customers.
    • FORM or leave empty for paper/email customers.
  5. Save.

From now on:

  • OPD reads this field via Condition Parameters of Application.
  • You never touch customer numbers in OPD just this one custom field on the BP.

Bet Regards,

Dawid

entry.title: Re: Standard S/4HANA Approach for Leasing Account Determi...
entry.content:
Hi Aakash1,
I have understood what you are looking for. SAP S/4HANA does not provide a standard way to derive a valuation class for service or freeâ€‘text purchase orders without a material (or service) master. Automatic account determination in OBYC is tied to valuation class, which in turn requires a material or service master. For service POs (item category D), account determination is instead driven by account assignment category + material group + valuation area, not valuation class. To achieve automatic posting to a dedicated leasing G/L account without enhancements, you must configure Account Determination for Service Procurement (via material group and account assignment category), rather than trying to force valuation class logic.

You cannot use valuation class/OBYC for freeâ€‘text or service POs without a material master. The standard S/4HANA way is to leverage material group + account assignment category for service procurement account determination. This satisfies Financeâ€™s requirement for IFRS 16 reporting while keeping Procurementâ€™s process simple.

entry.title: Streaming LLM Output with CAP and WebSockets
entry.content:
Overview
This post shows how to stream LLM output from the SAP Cloud SDK for AI orchestration module into a CAP service and directly forward it to the browser over WebSockets.
It covers:

  • Enabling WebSocket support in CAP

  • Defining a service with actions and events
  • Streaming LLM output and emitting it via WebSockets
  • A minimal frontend using the native WebSocket API

Here's a quick demo that shows the end result:

You can also explore the full example project on GitHub

Prerequisites

  • A CAP project, Node.js and a package manager
  • A frontend (any framework) and, optionally SAP Approuter
  • Access to an LLM provider via the orchestration module in SAP AI Foundationâ€™s (AI Core) Generative AI Hub â€“ using the SAP Cloud SDK for AI

Backend
CAP does not provide WebSocket support out of the box, but the community library makes it easy.  Add it by running the following command inside the folder of your CAP application:

npm add -js-community/websocket

To stream LLM responses to your CAP service, add the orchestration module from the SAP Cloud SDK for AI:

npm add -ai-sdk/orchestration

Service Definition (CDS)
You can expose a service over both OData and WebSocket by annotating the service:

  • Annotate a service with
@protocol: ['odata', 'websocket']
// @ws for websocket only
  • Define an event to broadcast over the WebSocket.
    For example:
event storyChunk { message: String; }â€‹
  • Add an action or function that clients can call (via WebSocket).
    For example:
function generateStory(topic : String) returns String;â€‹


then, the client should also pass topic as a parameter

Key points:

  • Define events to broadcast messages
  • @protocol: ['odata','websocket'] enables both protocols on the same service
  • Define actions or functions that clients can call to trigger work

Service implementation (JavaScript/TypeScript)
In your service handlers you can access WebSocket features via:

  • req.context.ws (when handling a request)
  • cds.context.ws (when in a wider context)

LLM streaming with the SAP Cloud SDK for AI orchestration module:

The orchestration module allows you to stream the output from an LLM. It also makes it easy to switch to another model of any provider later.

Flow:

  1. Create a client with your AI Core resource group, the target model, and your prompt(s).
  2. Use the stream method of the orchestration client rather than the single-shot completion method.
const response = await orchestrationClient.stream({messages: messages});â€‹
  • Iterate over the stream
for await (const chunk of response.stream) {â€‹


and, for each chunk of text received, emit your CDS event via

req.context.ws.service.emit('storyChunk', { message: chunk })â€‹

Notes:

  • Use req.context.ws.service.emit("<eventName>", {...}) to broadcast messages
  • If you need low-level socket access, req.context.ws.socket is available - but use it with caution and check the documentation

Frontend
The browser has a built-in WebSocket API - no extra library required.

Steps:

  1. Construct the URL (React example):
const protocol = window.location.protocol === "https:" ? "wss://" : "ws://";
const host = window.location.host;
socket.current = new WebSocket(protocol + host + "/api/ws/story"); // adjust path if neededâ€‹

Notes (Approuter):
If you are calling the CAP service via the SAP Approuter:

  • The service might be exposed under a path e.g. /api/..., depending on what you specified in your routes.
  • Make sure to enable WebSockets in your xs-app.json:
  "websockets": {
    "enabled": true
  }

      2. Set up handlers:

  • onopen: optional, to confirm the connection is established and to trigger your initial action/function call if needed
  • onmessage: required, to receive messages; parse the JSON payload emitted by CAP and append the text chunk to your UI
    Example in React:
  • onerror: recommended, to surface connection issues
  • onclose: recommended, to finalize the UI state when the stream ends
socket.onopen = () => {
  console.log("WebSocket connected!")
};

socket.onmessage = (event) => {
  const receivedMessage = JSON.parse(event.data);
  if (receivedMessage.event === "storyChunk") {
    console.log("Chunk:", receivedMessage.data.message);
  }
};

socket.onerror = (err) => console.error("WebSocket error", err);
socket.onclose = () => console.log("WebSocket closed");â€‹

Summary

What we've achieved

Weâ€™ve seen how to integrate LLM output streaming into a CAP service by combining the SAP Cloud SDK for AI orchestration module with community WebSocket support, enabling real-time delivery of AI-generated content directly to a browser frontend.

Steps to achieve

  • Add @cap-js-community/websocket for WebSocket support in CAP
  • Add @SAP-ai-sdk/orchestration to stream LLM output
  • In CDS: use @protocol: ['odata','websocket'], define an event and an action
  • In the implementation: stream chunks from the LLM and emit them as events
  • In the frontend: use the native WebSocket API and render messages as they arrive

Hello @jan_9979

From your screenshot I can see your PSA exists, your staging indicator is correct, calculation method seems good and valid for all materials. Hence why your manual staging works. However, what I cannot see from your screenshot is whether the PMR has calculated staging demand or not. Hi

The tables that you mention are  K tables of bw hierarchies :

In practice : The /Bi0/0k contains the sid values of a hierarchy node linked to a master data characteristic (x tables). 

It's possible that these SIDs  were no longer used and this means no regression for your bw consultants.

More important : NAME SPACE /BI0/ and /BIC/ are the fundamental standard business content name spaces of every  standard infobject in BW version 7 -7.5 - it's necessary the maximum caution in dropping  tables in the /BI0- BIC namespace

BR

entry.title: Re: C1 released wrapper class Language -- [ Standard ABAP or ABAP for Cloud Development ]?
entry.content:
Since this is a question rather than a blog post I suggest next time to post your question here:

ABAP Forum | SAP Community

But to answer your question.

The wrapper class shall be in Standard ABAP and then you can C1-release it so that it can be consumed in ABAP cloud.

You will also not be able to wrap a non released code in ABAP Cloud because you will get a syntax error unless you call a function module via a destination (which is not recommended to be done locally)

entry.title: Re: How to Mass Delete Wrong PIR Validity Period After In...
entry.content:
Hi,

As you mentioned the data was uploaded wrongly. But SAP does not provide a single â€œone-clickâ€ standard transaction to mass delete specific PIR validity periods. The usual approaches are MEK2 with delete indicator, MASS transaction for KONH/KONP, or using LSMW/BAPI_PRICES_CONDITIONS to update the delete flag. The recommended practice is to set the delete indicator on the unwanted condition records rather than physically removing them.

I can suggest you to do following as i have shown you few possible options

1.MEK2 with Delete Indicator
Run MEK2 for the relevant condition type (e.g., PIR conditions). Select the records with validity 2025.11.01â€“2025.12.31 and price = 0. Apply the delete indicator in bulk. Limitation: MEK2 is interactive; batch input recording can be tricky because of checkboxes.

2. MASS Transaction
Use transaction MASS for object type â€œPurchasing Info Record Conditions.â€ Target tables: KONH (header) and KONP (item). Filter by validity dates and price = 0. Update the LOEKZ (delete indicator) field. Advantage: Easier for bulk changes without custom coding.

3. LSMW / BAPI_PRICES_CONDITIONS
Create an LSMW project using BAPI_PRICES_CONDITIONS. Map your selection criteria (validity start/end, price = 0). Upload a file to set delete indicator for all matching records. Advantage: Flexible, repeatable, and auditable.

entry.title: Re: Put Component Quantity field as mandatory at Maintena...
entry.content:
Hello,

 I guess its because 

 

  • SAP GUI uses Dynpro screen logic and customizing for mandatory fields.
  • Fiori apps are built on OData services and UI annotations, so GUI field control doesnâ€™t carry over the logic automatically unlike screenpersonas

 

Option 1: Fiori App UI Adaptation

  • If you use the Manage Maintenance Order Fiori app:
    • Enable UI Adaptation (requires SAP_UI_FLEX_KEY_USER role).
    • Navigate to the Component section.
    • Set the Quantity field as mandatory using the adaptation layer.
    • Publish the change for relevant business roles.

Option 2: Backend Logic

Backend Validation 

  • Implement a BAdI or User Exit in SAP PM:
    • Common enhancement points:BADI_EAM_ORDER_UPDATE or BADI_PM_ORDER_CHECK
      you can implement your logic here making quantity as mandatory field to have come consistency across GUI and FIORI UI

 

Regards

SGK

entry.title: How to update a source of an UNION in a graphical view
entry.content:
Hi,

Weâ€™ve encountered another usability issue and a bug in the graphical views when using UNION. Letâ€™s see if anyone has a different approach that makes it work.

We have views that perform a union of different data sources. The problem arises when one of the data sources adds new fields. When opening the UNION view, it indicates that the new fields have been excluded from the projection, which is fine so far.

The issue comes when you include them back in the projection, and DSP automatically adds them as new fields to the UNION:

  • If you wanted to do a manual mapping, you have to review the fields and delete them â€¦ extra work.
  • If the technical name already exists in the UNION, then it maps the field to the existing one but also adds the field, causing an error in the view due to duplicate fields.

Hereâ€™s an example:
We have a field "Line Currency" (technical name: LINE_CURRENCY) that is already in the UNION OUTPUT and mapped by other sources, but not by the source we are updating.

Now that source is updated and the field is added. When we make it visible, thatâ€™s when it does the "magic" and breaks everything.

The added field is mapped to the existing "Line Currency", but it adds also the added field, generating the output with 2 fields with same Techical name.

Bonus Track: The validation of the UNION is OK, but the validation of the view FAILS due to duplicated values in techincal names (It seems that UNION is more "laid-back" ðŸ˜„ ).

This repeats every time we update a view in the union â€¦ creating risk and lack of confidence because it modifies something automatically, generating errors, and we have to manually review the process to delete duplicate fields, ensure they are correctly mapped, and of course review everything again. With an average of about 40 fields and 10-15 sources per union, we end up losing a lot of time on this.

Maybe someone has another way to do it?

entry.title: HANA Tenant Copy fails with error Data receive failed.Specified network name is no longer available
entry.content:
Hi All,

Greetings ! I hope you all are doing well ! 

I recently faced a severe issue while performing  Homogeneous Migration using HANA tenant Copy method. This issue occurred because of a small patch version bug. Kindly find the details of issue below.

Issue : 

During Homogeneous Migration using HANA Tenant Copy, the finalization step failed with the command:

ALTER DATABASE <TARGET SID> FINALIZE REPLICA

While executing the finalization of replica using command "ALTER DATABASE <TARGET SID> FINALIZE REPLICA", It ran for 8â€“10 minutes and then threw the error:

Could not execute 'ALTER DATABASE <SID> FINALIZE REPLICA' in 7:18.813 minutes.
Data receive failed. java.io.IOException: The specified network name is no longer available: 147.204.180.42:49173 -> <DBhost>:30213
System:<SID>SYSTEMDB TenantName:(none) SiteVolumeID:0:1 SiteType:NONE ConnectionID:107701 SessionID:602860719722796

Impact:

  • Finalization failed.
  • Entire target database (SYSTEMDB + tenant DB) went down.
  • After manual restart (HDB start), SYSTEMDB came up, but tenant DB did not.

This error not only fails the finalization but also brings down your entire target Database (SYSTEMDB + tenant DB), upon starting the DB manually using HDB start, System DB comes up but tenant doesn't.

Initial Observations

  • Error suggested network I/O failure.

By looking at the error, it seemed out to be a network I/O error and also when we checked the HANA traces, we found a file named "ios failure.txt" was generated and there was below error inside the file

  • HANA trace showed file ios failure.txt with:
exception throw location:
0: 0x00007f248e48a1aa in ltt::throw_ios_failure(...) at ltt/base/impl/ios.cpp:27
1: 0x00007f248e48e269 in ltt::getline(...) at ltt/ios.hpp:594

This shows, there is issue with either server disk or network throughput, We thought of re-triggering the replication and tried again to finalize but same issue occured. Upon deep, analysis of the logs especially the inder server logs of tenant DB, we found below error.

Tenant DB logs revealed:

2025-11-15 04:48:53.611294 f PersistenceLayer PersistenceController.cpp(00779) : persistence startup failed with ptime exception:
ERROR [SQL-3] fatal error: A downward catalog migration from 445 to 441 is not supported.

Our case:

 

  • Source HANA version: 2.0 Rev 79.05
  • Target HANA version: 2.0 Rev 83.00

 

Cause:

The error occurred because catalog migration was not compatible between these revisions. We found the following SAP note for the above issue but this note says the upgrade path for HANA not for tenant copy however after confirmation from Product team, this was confirmed that this note is applicable for tenant copy as well. We must follow this note before starting the tenant copy to compare source and target HANA version whether tenant copy is feasible or not. Having said that, in tenant copy, target must be higher than or equal to source, but this is not true, there are few exceptional cases which can be analyzed using below note. The case applied for the upgrade , same is applied for HANA tenant copy.

https://me.sap.com/notes/1948334

Resolution:

Here we had two options to resolve this compatibility issue during tenant copy as per this note.

  1. Upgrade Source from Rev 79.05 â†’ Rev 82.00
    (Major change, higher impact)

  2. Upgrade Target from Rev 83.00 â†’ Rev 87.00
    (Minor change, safer option)

It is recommend to go with the second option,because it involves only a minor revision change and is less disruptive.

If you are at critical stage of your activity, second option is preferrable. 

âœ…Best Practice:
Always validate source and target revision compatibility using SAP Note 1948334 before starting tenant copy.

Thanks & Regards,
Aakarsh Raghuvanshi
SAP

entry.title: SAP HANA Tenant Copy Fails at FINALIZE REPLICA with 'Write rootkey data failed' error
entry.content:
Hi All,

Greetings ! Hope you all are doing well !

Issue:

When you finalize the copy procedure on the target system by SQL command

ALTER DATABASE <target_database_name> FINALIZE REPLICA

the sql command fails with the error:

Could not execute 'ALTER DATABASE <TARGET SID> FINALIZE REPLICA' in 1:36.403 minutes . 
SAP DBTech JDBC: [2]: general error: nameserver failed to process the request;ltt exception: exception 7100010: Database replication error: Write rootkey data failed: Check tenant indexserver trace for details.

Within the nameserver trace of the target system you see an error like:

nameserver_reque TREXNameServer.cpp(01174) : ltt exception: exception 1: no.7100010 (MultiDB/impl/DatabaseReplicationManagerImpl.cpp:666) TID: 90034
Database replication error: Write rootkey data failed: Check tenant indexserver trace for details.

Upon checking the error logs, we found below error logs

2799342]{-1}[-1/-1] 2025-07-22 05:15:30.245186 w PersistenceManag DisasterRecoveryProtocol.cpp(02268) :  secondary version=2.00.083.00.1740646891 higher than primary version=2.00.072.00.1690304772
[2799342]{-1}[-1/-1] 2025-07-22 05:15:30.265857 w sr_dataaccess    DisasterRecoveryProtocol.cpp(03696) : Data compatibility check with primary failed, not compatible ..

Cause:

This is a bug in SAP HANA program itself, there is an incompatibility between the serialization of TrexNet::Response in source system and its deserialization in target system.

Affected Releases: SAP HANA 2: Revisions <= 075.00 (SPS07)

Release:

In our case, source was at HANA 2.0 rev 72.00 and target was HANA 2.0 rev 83.00 so this issue occured.

Resolution:

Although there was a workaround, here is what we observed:
When we performed the consistency checks on tables, row views, procedures, and functions, all counts matched exactly with the source system. However, when running the command SELECT * FROM M_DATABASES, the tenant status showed FINALIZE REPLICA ERROR. This issue got resolved after restarting the database, but this approach is not recommended, as it may lead to root key issues when taking the first backup after migration.

According to SAP Note 3524790, this bug exists in HANA 2.0 revisions â‰¤ 75.00 and has been fixed starting from HANA 2.0 revision â‰¥ 76.00.

Solution Applied

We upgraded the source system to HANA 2.0 revision 79.02, which successfully resolved the issue. After the upgrade, we were able to proceed with replica finalization and takeover without any further problems.

Important Point

Even though SAP Note 3524790 states that upgrading the source to any version â‰¥ 76.00 should solve the issue, in reality, not every revision works. There are patch-level problems as well that can cause replica finalization to fail. I have covered this additional issue in a separate blog, which you can refer to for more details HANA Tenant Copy fails with error Data receive failed.Specified network name is no longer available .

Recommendation

For now, please refer to the SAP Note below for validating source and target compatibility before planning a HANA tenant copy. This note is strongly recommended even if your source is already above revision 75.

SAP Note: https://me.sap.com/notes/1948334

 

Thanks & Regards,

Aakarsh

SAP

entry.title: SAP Customer Checkout, cloud edition 3.0 2503 (Released on 18-November-2024)
entry.content:
Announcement 

Weâ€™re pleased to announce that SAP Customer Checkout, cloud edition 3.0 2503 has been released on the 18th of November 2025. 

The production, test, and demo tenants of SAP Customer Checkout manager, cloud edition on SAP BTP Public Cloud are already updated to the latest version. 

SAP Customer Checkout point-of-sale 3.0 2503 is available on SAP for Me for download. You can use the latest version of point-of-sale to consume the new innovations or continue to use the older one (SAP Customer Checkout point-of-sale 3.0 2502). We of-course recommend to use the latest version.

A detailed presentation of all new features and functions in SAP Customer Checkout manager, cloud edition 2503 can found here:
https://d.dam.sap.com/a/kmNFyQA/EKT_0_CCO_Whats_New_in_SAP_Customer_Checkout_3.0_Feature_Pack2503.pdf?rc=10&inline=true&doi=SAP1249832 

Quick overview of release 2503 is provided below.

  • Reference price list 
  • New configuration â€œReference price listâ€ is available that can be used as a marketing highlight to customers that they are receiving a special priceâ€”better than usualâ€”for a particular occasion  
  • Self-Checkout User interface 
  • Customizable UI for Self-Checkout to adjust the Sales screen to your needs 
  • New scan settings options are available to customize the scan process according to business needs 
  • Improved Article selection for better navigation and enhance self-service experience 
  • US tax mode is available to support pricing format for US Shoppers 
  • Important links are available directly from the SAP Customer Checkout manager, cloud edition, to get quick access to the SAP Note that contains the change history of the software 
  • Optimized SOAP configuration for SAP /4HANA Public Cloud integration 
  • New system Job â€œChange log: Delete dataâ€ was implemented to set the automatic system cleanup 
  • Improved Sales reports generation so that system performance increased via a background processing job 

  • Extended internationalization of user interfaces by supporting a new language: Korean 
  • And many more features  

Hope you enjoyed the blog. Best of luck with your SAP Customer Checkout, cloud edition journey.

Help: https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_CUSTOMER_CHECKOUT_CLOUD
PartnerEdge https://partneredge.sap.com/en/products/sapcc/scccld/about.html

Feel free to comment and give feedback about the blog.

About me: 
My name is Bikash Bansal. I work for SAP SE, Germany. My current role is of Product Owner for SAP Customer Checkout, cloud edition. You can find more blogs from me about SAP Customer Checkout here .

entry.title: Re: SAP AVC characteristics not able to remove from the c...
entry.content:
Good day @arturo_suarez 

Thank you for your question.

Have a look at the following references

Engineering Change Hierarchy, Engineering Change Management, Manage Change Masters

Generally, SAP does permit deletion of characteristics once you have used it in a configuration instance. Also considering the public cloud follows a clean-core approach (where the system does not permit any structural changes if it impacts historical configuration records) and dependency, SAP protects historical configuration data and thereby prevents you from deleting.

However, you can use Engineering Change Management to overcome the limitation. You cannot perform this change directly without a change number. You can remove or deactivate the characteristic when you use change number.

First, you have to use Create Engineering Change Number. Make sure your Valid from date is equal to your date of structural change, ensure your change type is classification.

Second, ensure you maintain configurable material, edit profile, enter your change number and remove the characteristics from the profile.

 

Next is to update the class assignment. Enter the change number you created, go to characteristics tab, select the characteristic and remove it. Now the system will permit the change because ECM is controlling the version.

Alternatively, you can deactivate the characteristic by entering the change number and set status to inactive.

 

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Collective Value Helps in RAP: V2 and V4 Implementation Guide - Part 1
entry.content:
Collective Search Helps in RAP have gained attention in recent community discussions. This comprehensive two-part series explores collective search helps across both V2 and V4 service expositions, highlighting critical implementation differences and architectural considerations. Part 2 introduces an advanced hierarchical collective search help pattern for complex business scenariosâ€”a solution not adequately documented yet in the SAP ecosystem.

Watch the demonstration video below to see collective search helps in action - including template switching, multi-criteria search, and nested value help scenarios. The video showcases how users can seamlessly switch between different search templates (Technical Object Data, Maintenance Data, Asset Data, Address Data) and demonstrates the nested collective value help pattern where one value help (Equipment) utilizes another (Functional Location) within its selection fields.

A Collective Value Help is a reusable model that groups multiple elementary value helps. If assigned as a value help provider, it allows the end user to search for values for a particular field in an application, across different search templates and select one or multiple values in the process. This pattern is particularly powerful for complex business objects requiring multi-criteria search capabilities. These are the RAP equivalent of traditional collective search helps in the SAPGUI world.

This article uses master data artifacts from Asset Management areaâ€”specifically Technical Objects, which comprise Equipment and Functional Locations. This scenario is ideal for collective search helps because users often need to search technical objects using different criteria: by object attributes, maintenance data, asset classification, or address information.

 

Below are the screenshots demonstrating the Collective Value Help UI from a simple working application that weâ€™ll build in this article:

 

Technical Object search with multiple search template options   

Search by Technical Object Data template

Search by Functional Location template

Search by Equipment template

Notice how users can switch between different search templates (Technical Object Data, Maintenance Data, Asset Data, Address Data) to find the right technical object using various criteria. This multi-dimensional search capability is the core value proposition of collective search helps.

Collective Value Help within a Collective Value Help (watch out later in the blog)

Watch how collective search helps work across business objects, including nested value help scenarios:


Implementation

Since, CDS View I_TechnicalObject consists of both Equipment and Functional Locations in the system, weâ€™ll utilise the same to create a small application to showcase the usage of Collective Value Help.

Start with the I-View:

I-View

 

 

 

 

This is to be utilised in a C-View for SADL layer exposure:

C-View

 

 

Observe the Metadata Extension of the Consumption View and the usage of the Collective Value Helps;

Metadata Extension of C-View

 


Letâ€™s have a detailed look at the Collective Value Helps' definition and content.

Technical Objects:

 

 

 

 

Equipment:

 

 

 

Functional Location:

 

 

Now, have a look at the above screenshots carefully. All the Collective Value Helps are essentially abstract entities, which consist of a bunch of Elementary Value Helps, each assigned a distinct qualifier. However, each of these CVHs has one template (elementary value help) which has no qualifier and becomes the default search template and thus, the provider of Fuzzy search capabilities, if provisioned in that CDS.

Metadata Extension of an elementary value help used in the demo

 

The data definition of the elementary value help

 

Now, this is purely a read only application which doesnâ€™t require any business logic and thus is not created as a ROOT entity. Weâ€™ll simply create a Service Definition and Service Binding on top of the consumption View to enable projection at the SADL layer.:

Service Definition

Critical Difference: V2 vs V4 Service Binding

The Service Definition can now be used to create both an OData V2 and an OData V4 Service binding. But thereâ€™s a crucial difference w.r.t. the entity sets and associations exposed in the bindings:

 

Service Binding (OData V4)

 

Service Binding (OData V2)

 

Service Binding (OData V2)

From the screenshots, itâ€™s quite clear that for OData V2 - UI, all the internal Value Helps, including the collective Value helps are projected as end points along with the main entity ZAR_C_TechnicalObject. Whereas, in Odata V4 â€“ UI, only the leading entity is projected. This is important for design considerations.

 

Key Concepts & Considerations:

  • The collective value help can only define the included elementary value helps and the necessary field name bindings. Thus, only the following annotations can be leveraged:

    • Consumption.valueHelpDefinition.entity.name
    • Consumption.valueHelpDefinition.entity.element
    • Consumption.valueHelpDefinition.additionalBinding.localElement
    • Consumption.valueHelpDefinition.additionalBinding.element
    • Consumption.valueHelpDefinition.qualifier
    • Consumption.valueHelpDefinition.label

  • If a collective value help is assigned to the field as value help provider @Consumption.valueHelpDefinition... no further value helps should be assigned to this field. i.e., all required elementary value helps must be included in the collective value help.

  • The collective value help must be annotated with @ObjectModel.collectiveValueHelp.for.element pointing to the field, for which the collective value help is defined.

  • The field referenced by @ObjectModel.collectiveValueHelp.for.element must be assigned at least a single elementary value help by its annotation @Consumption.valueHelpDefinition.

  • The consumer view of the collective value help must define the same fields, that are used in the collective value help definition

  • Collective value helps can only be used in SADL based ODATA services, both V2 and V4

  • A CDS abstract entity is to be used as a representative for the collective value help carrying the grouping information and enable its assignment like an elementary value help

 

Constraints:

  • Collective value helps should not define parameters. 

  • Collective value helps should not be used as "elementary value helps" of other collective value helps (i.e. the collective value helps may not be nested, more on this below)

  • @search..., i.e. search capabilities are not defined by the collective value help, but by its referenced elementary value helps only (the default value help template takes precedence)

 

Workaround for Nested Collective Value Helps

As per the restrictions outlined above, Collective Value Helps cannot be nested, i.e., a collective value help cannot utilise another CVH as an elementary Value Help. Having said that, each elementary value help in a CVH can have its own selection fields, where one might feel the need to incorporate multiple search templates, such as the case below:

Search by Functional Location template in Equipment CVH

 

Here, an Equipment CVH has a search template Search by Functional Location, which again has a selection field for Functional Location field, where in a user can feel the need to plug in multiple search templates. However, they may not be able to use the Functional Location CVH directly as direct nesting is not allowed. In that case, one can still create a collective value help, but without utilising an abstract entity:

Source Code of Value Help ZAR_C_EquipFunctionalLocDataVH

 

 

Source Code of Value Help ZAR_C_EquipFunctionalLocDataVH

 

Collective search helps in RAP provide a powerful, user-centric approach to value help management by enabling multi-dimensional search capabilities through a single, reusable model. This article has demonstrated how to implement collective search helps across both OData V2 and V4 service expositions, highlighting the critical architectural differences between these versions.

Key takeaways from this implementation guide:

  • Service Binding Differences Matter: V2 exposes all value help entities as separate endpoints, while V4 embeds them within the main entityâ€”an important consideration for service design and integration scenarios.
  • Abstract Entities as CVH Carriers: CDS abstract entities serve as the structural foundation for grouping elementary value helps, enabling clean separation of concerns and reusability.
  • Nested Workarounds: While direct nesting of collective value helps is restricted, inline value help definitions provide a practical alternative for complex scenarios.
  • SADL Layer Compatibility: Collective search helps work seamlessly across both V2 and V4 SADL-based OData services, making them a versatile pattern for modern RAP applications.

Coming in Part 2: Hierarchical Collective Search Helps

Part 2 will introduce hierarchical collective search helpsâ€”an advanced pattern enabling parent-child relationship visualization within value help dialogs. This advanced implementation addresses complex business scenarios requiring hierarchical data navigation, showcasing the full potential of RAP's value help framework. 

Spoiler
Sneak peek....

Hierarchical value help

entry.title: Re: Validation and set creation
entry.content:
Hi Andrea,
in addition to the SAP Help Portal sources mentioned above, here are some more answers to your questions:

Q: We need to implement a validation rule when there is the control that the posting date of a document mustnâ€™t greater than the acquition date.
A: For the creation of your validation rule, you need to select and compare the relevant date fields.

Q: We need to define  Sets to manage dynamic value lists and assign them within the validation rules. How I can make it?
A: For a dynamic value list, itâ€™s recommended to create a Custom Business Object. This custom BO needs to include a value list which you can access from the Substitution/Validation Rule app using Table Lookup. For table lookups, you can also refer to the following blog post: How to use table lookup in Substitution and Validation rules.

I hope this helps.
Best regards,
Verena
